sen.j: 銀杏髷（いちょうまげ）とは江戸時代を通して最も一般的だった男性の髪形を指す。
sen.e: Ichomage is the most popular men's hairstyle in the Edo period.
Ichomage is the most popular men's hairstyle through the Edo period.
Ichomage is the most popular men's hairstyle through the Edo period.

sen.j: 銀杏頭とも。
sen.e: It is also called "Icho-atama."
It is also called Ichoatama.
It is also called Ichoatama.

sen.j: また女性の島田髷のバリエーションにも同名のものがある。
sen.e: One variation of Shimada (a Japanese hairstyle for unmarried women) has the same name as this.
One variation of Shimadamage (a Japanese hairstyle with a knot for a woman in olden times) has the same name as this.
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: One variation of Shimadamage (a Japanese hairstyle with a knot for a woman in olden times) has the same name as this.

sen.j: （現在一般に「ちょんまげ」と呼ばれるのはこの髷のことだが、本来の「丁髷」は髪の少ない老人などが結う貧相な髷を言う言葉でまったくの別物。）
sen.e: ("Chonmage" commonly known nowadays refers to this hairstyle; however, "Chonmage" was originally a poor-looking hairstyle worn by thin-haired old men, and is a completely different thing.)
('Chonmage' commonly known nowadays refers to this hairstyle; however, 'Chonmage' was originally a poor-looking hairstyle worn by thin-haired old men, and is a completely different thing.)
('Chonmage' commonly known nowadays refers to this hairstyle; however, 'Chonmage' was originally a poor-looking hairstyle worn by thin-haired old men, and is a completely different thing.)

sen.j: 月代（さかやき）を剃り、髻を作って頭頂部に向けて折り返しその先（刷毛先）を銀杏の葉のように広げたもの（広げない場合も多い）。
sen.e: The front part of the head is shaved, and the hair is tied into a topknot, which is folded on the top of the head with its ends splayed out to form a ginkgo leaf (in many cases, the ends of the topknot are not splayed out elaborately).

The front part of the head is shaved, and the rest of hair is tied into a topknot, which is folded on the top of the head with its ends splayed out to form a ginkgo leaf (in many cases, the ends of the topknot are not splayed out elaborately).

The front part of the head is shaved, and the rest of hair is tied into a topknot, which is folded on the top of the head with its ends splayed out to form a ginkgo leaf (in many cases, the ends of the topknot are not splayed out elaborately).

sen.j: 身分や職業によって結い方に特徴がある。
sen.e: The style of Icho-mage varies according to social status and occupation.
The style of Ichomage varies according to social status and occupation.
The style of Ichomage varies according to social status and occupation.

sen.j: 武家の男髷の特徴は、髷が長く、月代は狭く側頭部の生え際（小鬢）を自然のままに残す、髱は、ひっつめて質実剛健な感じにすること。
sen.e: Men's hairstyles of the warrior class were characteristically arranged in such a way that a topknot was made long, the front part of the head was shaved narrowly, sidelocks were left natural, and the chignon was tied tightly so as to look simple and austere.

Men's hairstyles of the warrior class were characteristically arranged in such a way that a topknot was made long, the front part of the head was shaved narrowly, sideburns were left natural, and the back part was tied tightly so as to look simple and austere.
sen.cmt: 単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: Men's hairstyles of the warrior class were characteristically arranged in such a way that a topknot was made long, the front part of the head was shaved narrowly, sideburns were left natural, and the back part was tied tightly so as to look simple and austere.

sen.j: ただし、任務の都合上、町人に変装することもある与力などには町人と同じように生え際をまっすぐにそり落とすものもいた。
sen.e: However, Yoriki (police sergeants), who had to disguise themselves as townspeople for the sake of their duties, shaved their hairline straightly just like townspeople.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, some of Yoriki (police sergeant), who had to disguise themselves as townspeople for the sake of their duties, shaved their hairline straightly just like townspeople.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ文法を修正しました
sen.e: However, some of Yoriki (police sergeant), who had to disguise themselves as townspeople for the sake of their duties, shaved their hairline straightly just like townspeople.

sen.j: 「江戸の三男」（えどのさんおとこ）にふさわしい粋な人物が多かったらしい。
sen.e: Many of them were said to be fashinable and worthy of being called "Edo no san otoko" (men with three popular occupations in Edo: Yoriki [a police sergeants], Rikishi [a sumo wrestler], and Hikeshi [a fireman]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Many of them were said to be fashionable and worthy of being called 'Edo no san otoko' (men with three popular occupations in Edo: Yoriki [a police sergeants], Rikishi [a sumo wrestler], and Hikeshi [a fireman]).
sen.cmt: スペルミス、記号を修正しました
sen.e: Many of them were said to be fashionable and worthy of being called 'Edo no san otoko' (men with three popular occupations in Edo: Yoriki [a police sergeants], Rikishi [a sumo wrestler], and Hikeshi [a fireman]).

sen.j: 野暮の代名詞である「浅黄裏」をはじめ、一部のしゃれ者を除いた武士の多くには大銀杏が好まれた。
sen.e: Except some dandies, many samurai warriors including "Asagiura" (a country samurai), which was a typical example of a clumsy fellow, were fond of Oicho (a more elaborate form of Icho-mage).
Except some dandies, many samurai warriors including 'Asagiura' (a country samurai), who was a typical example of a rustic fellow, were fond of Oicho (a more elaborate form of Ichomage).
sen.cmt: 記号、文法、単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: Except some dandies, many samurai warriors including 'Asagiura' (a country samurai), who was a typical example of a rustic fellow, were fond of Oicho (a more elaborate form of Ichomage).

sen.j: 髷尻と呼ばれる髷の折り返しの元の部分が後頭部より後ろに真っ直ぐ出っ張っているのが特徴で、町人の銀杏髷より髷が長く、髷先は頭頂部に触れるくらいで刷毛先はほとんどつぶれない。
sen.e: Characteristically, the U-shaped part of the topknot called Magejiri protruded straightly from the back of the head, the topknot was longer than that of townspeople's Icho-mage, and the tip of the topknot slightly touched the top of the head almost without being smashed.

Characteristically, the U-shaped part of the topknot called magejiri protruded straightly from the back of the head, and the topknot was longer than that of townspeople's Ichomage, and the end of the topknot slightly touched the top of the head almost without being crushed.
sen.cmt: 記号、単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: Characteristically, the U-shaped part of the topknot called magejiri protruded straightly from the back of the head, and the topknot was longer than that of townspeople's Ichomage, and the end of the topknot slightly touched the top of the head almost without being crushed.

sen.j: なかでも野暮ったい田舎の藩主などは頭頂部より前にのめりだすような、まるで蒲鉾をくっつけた状態の太長い髷をこれ見よがしに結うものもいた。
sen.e: Especially, some unsophisticated feudal lords in local provinces showed off the thick and long topknot, which stuck out from the top of the head, as if they put a semicylindrical-shaped Kamaboko (fish sausage) on their head.

Especially, some unsophisticated feudal lords in local provinces showed off the thick and long topknot, which stuck out from the top of the head, as if they put a semicylindrical-shaped Kamaboko (fish sausage) on their head.

Especially, some unsophisticated feudal lords in local provinces showed off the thick and long topknot, which stuck out from the top of the head, as if they put a semicylindrical-shaped Kamaboko (fish sausage) on their head.

sen.j: 髱はぴったりと撫で付けられている。
sen.e: The chignon was tightly smoothed down.
The back part was tightly smoothed down.
sen.cmt: 単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: The back part was tightly smoothed down.

sen.j: 武士ではあるが、町人の中に住まって犯罪捜査に従事する「不浄役人」の与力はもっと町方風の粋な銀杏髷を結っている。
sen.e: Yoriki called "Fujo yakunin" (dirty officials), who lived among townspeople to be engaged in criminal investigation, arranged their hair more stylish similar to townspeople's Icho-mage.
Yoriki called 'Fujo yakunin' (dirty officials), who lived among townspeople to be engaged in criminal investigation, arranged their hair more stylish similar to townspeople's Ichomage.
Yoriki called 'Fujo yakunin' (dirty officials), who lived among townspeople to be engaged in criminal investigation, arranged their hair more stylish similar to townspeople's Ichomage.

sen.j: 髷尻が短く髷自体も短くて細い。
sen.e: The U-shaped part of the topknot was short, and the topknot itself was also short and thin.
The U-shaped part of the topknot was short, and the topknot itself was also short and thin.
The U-shaped part of the topknot was short, and the topknot itself was also short and thin.

sen.j: 髷先を軽く広げ月代の広いサッパリとした「細刷毛小銀杏」がそれで、町人とも武士とも見分けがつきにくい。
sen.e: One example was neat and tidy looking "Hosohake Shoicho" (small ginkgo leaf style), in which the ends of the topknot were splayed to form a small semicircle, and the front part of the head was widely shaved; so it is equally close to both hairstyles of samurai and townspeople.
sen.cmt: 「細刷毛小銀杏」の読み方がわかりませんでしたが左記のように訳出しました
sen.e: One example was neat and tidy looking 'Hosohake Shoicho' (small ginkgo leaf style), in which the ends of the topknot were splayed lightly, and the front part of the head was widely shaved; so it is equally close to both hairstyles of samurai and townspeople.
sen.cmt: 「細刷毛小銀杏」の読み方不明です。記号を修正しました原文に無い意訳を削除しました
sen.e: One example was neat and tidy looking 'Hosohake Shoicho' (small ginkgo leaf style), in which the ends of the topknot were splayed lightly, and the front part of the head was widely shaved; so it is equally close to both hairstyles of samurai and townspeople.

sen.j: 同じ街中で暮らすにしても浪人などは月代をきれいに剃らず節約のため五分刈り状態で伸ばしていた。
sen.e: Ronin (masterless samurai), who also lived among townspeople, saved money by not shaving the front part of the head neatly, and the hair was closely cropped.
Ronin (masterless samurai), who also lived among townspeople, saved their money by not shaving the front part of the head neatly and left the hair growing which looked like close-cropped hairstyle.
sen.cmt: 後半の訳を修正しました
sen.e: Ronin (masterless samurai), who also lived among townspeople, saved their money by not shaving the front part of the head neatly and left the hair growing which looked like close-cropped hairstyle.

sen.j: 髱にはわずかにふくらみを持たせる。
sen.e: The chignon was slightly made fluffy.
The back part was slightly made fluffy.
sen.cmt: 単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: The back part was slightly made fluffy.

sen.j: いわゆる「江戸っ子」は髪形に気を使っていて、いつもきれいに剃りあげようと散髪屋に足しげく通ったために散髪屋が社交場になるほどだった。
sen.e: So-called "Edokko" (a person born and bred in Edo) was particular about his hairstyle and frequently visited a barbershop to have his hair cut neatly, so that the barber shop became a good meeting place.

So-called 'Edokko' (a person born and bred in Edo) was particular about his hairstyle and frequently visited a barbershop to have his hair cut neatly, so that the barber shop became a good meeting place.

So-called 'Edokko' (a person born and bred in Edo) was particular about his hairstyle and frequently visited a barbershop to have his hair cut neatly, so that the barber shop became a good meeting place.

sen.j: 彼らの好みはやはり「小銀杏」だが、ここでも職業によって微妙に違いが見られる。
sen.e: Townspeople were definitely fond of "Shoicho" hairstyle; however, a slight difference came out according to occupation.
Townspeople were definitely fond of 'Shoicho' hairstyle; however, a slight difference came out according to occupation.
Townspeople were definitely fond of 'Shoicho' hairstyle; however, a slight difference came out according to occupation.

sen.j: 商人は客商売ということもあってか、小さな控えめな髷を結った。
sen.e: Tradesmen preferred the small and plain topknot partly because they were engaged in the service industry.
Merchants preferred the small and plain topknot partly because they were engaged in the service industry.
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: Merchants preferred the small and plain topknot partly because they were engaged in the service industry.

sen.j: 正面からはちらりとしか見えない髷先などは頭から落ちかけているような状態で、髷尻もぽっちりとして短く小さい。
sen.e: The ends of the topknot, which was barely seen in the front, almost slided down the head, and the U-shaped part of the topknot was very short and compact.
The ends of the topknot, which was barely seen from the front, almost slid down the head, and the U-shaped part of the topknot was very short and compact.
sen.cmt: 文法、スペルミスを修正しました
sen.e: The ends of the topknot, which was barely seen from the front, almost slid down the head, and the U-shaped part of the topknot was very short and compact.

sen.j: 一方その息子の若旦那などは細く優美な本多髷を好んでゆった。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the young masters who were sons of those tradesmen were fond of graceful Hondamage hairstyle.
Meanwhile, the young masters who were sons of those merchants were fond of graceful Hondamage hairstyle.
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: Meanwhile, the young masters who were sons of those merchants were fond of graceful Hondamage hairstyle.

sen.j: 一方、伝法肌の職人は、髷尻短く反りあがり、全体に太短い髷は先を散らして男っぽく結い上げる。
sen.e: Additionally, spirited craftsmen were fond of the hairstyle in which the U-shaped part of the topknot was bent up at the tip, and the ends of the topknot that was fairly thick and short were roughly splayed out to look manish.

Additionally, spirited craftsmen were fond of the hairstyle in which the U-shaped part of the topknot was bent up at the tip, and the ends of the topknot that was fairly thick and short were roughly splayed out to look manly.
sen.cmt: 単語を原文に合わせて変更しました
sen.e: Additionally, spirited craftsmen were fond of the hairstyle in which the U-shaped part of the topknot was bent up at the tip, and the ends of the topknot that was fairly thick and short were roughly splayed out to look manly.

sen.j: 逆にすっきりした髷が好みの職人は細い髷にして刷毛先を粋にちょっと曲げてみたりなどもした。
sen.e: In contrast, craftsmen who were fond of simple styles made the topknot thin, and twisted the ends of the topknot sideways a little.
In contrast, craftsmen who were fond of simple styles made the topknot thin, and twisted the ends of the topknot sideways a little.
In contrast, craftsmen who were fond of simple styles made the topknot thin, and twisted the ends of the topknot sideways a little.

sen.j: 髱は、袋付と言って、下に膨らませる場合が多かった。
sen.e: In most cases, the chignon bulged at the bottom, which was called "Fukurozuke."
In most cases, the tabo (the back part of the Japanese hairstyle protruding backward) was bulged at the bottom, which was called Fukuroduke.
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しましたスペルミスを修正しました
sen.e: In most cases, the tabo (the back part of the Japanese hairstyle protruding backward) was bulged at the bottom, which was called Fukuroduke.

sen.j: 少女の銀杏髷
sen.e: Icho-mage for young girls
Icho-mage for young girls
Icho-mage for young girls

sen.j: 6～8歳くらいまでは少女も芥子坊主だが、これを過ぎると髪の毛を伸ばし始める。
sen.e: Young girls had "Keshibozu" hairstyle (the hair shaved except at the top of the head like a poppy's fruit) until the age of six to eight; however, after that, they began to wear their hair long.
Young girls had "Keshibozu" hairstyle (the hair shaved except at the top of the head like a poppy's fruit) until the age of six to eight; however, after that, they began to wear their hair long.
Young girls had "Keshibozu" hairstyle (the hair shaved except at the top of the head like a poppy's fruit) until the age of six to eight; however, after that, they began to wear their hair long.

sen.j: 十分に伸びて結綿、桃割れや稚児髷を結える様になるまでの間、少女も銀杏髷や銀杏崩し（関西では「竹の節」と呼ばれる）を結う（おたばこぼんの場合もある）。
sen.e: Young girls also had Icho-mage and Icho-kuzushi (a variation of Icho-mage) hairstyles (called 'Takenofushi' in the Kansai Region) until their hair grew long enough to wear Yuimage (a chignon bound up with a cotton band), Momoware (a bun resembling a halved peach), or Chigomage (a form of hair formerly worn by children) hairstyles. (Sometimes they had also Otabakobon hairstyle (hairstyle resembling a handle of a tobacco tray).

Young girls also had hairstyles like Ichomage and Ichokuzushi (a variation of Ichomage) (called 'Takenofushi' in the Kansai Region) until their hair grew long enough to wear Yuiwata (hair style like cotton wrapped up), Momoware (literally, split peach; female hair style in kimono that the bun is split and a red fabric woven in the center), or Chigomage (hairstyle for kids) hairstyles (Sometimes they had also Otabakobon hairstyle [hairstyle resembling a handle of a tobacco tray]).
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました記号を修正しました
sen.e: Young girls also had hairstyles like Ichomage and Ichokuzushi (a variation of Ichomage) (called 'Takenofushi' in the Kansai Region) until their hair grew long enough to wear Yuiwata (hair style like cotton wrapped up), Momoware (literally, split peach; female hair style in kimono that the bun is split and a red fabric woven in the center), or Chigomage (hairstyle for kids) hairstyles (Sometimes they had also Otabakobon hairstyle [hairstyle resembling a handle of a tobacco tray]).

sen.j: この髪型の間は眉を剃る。
sen.e: While wearing those hairstyles, young girls had their eyebrows shaved.
While wearing those hairstyles, young girls had their eyebrows shaved.
While wearing those hairstyles, young girls had their eyebrows shaved.

sen.j: 手古舞の髪型
sen.e: Hairstyle of Tekomai (dance performed by geisha)
Hairstyle of Tekomai (float leading dance)
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: Hairstyle of Tekomai (float leading dance)

sen.j: 現在は祭りで若い女性が扮する場合が多い手古舞は元々は芸者の男装に由来。
sen.e: Tekomai dance, which is now performed mostly by young women in festival, originated from geisha in male clothing.
Tekomai, which is now performed mostly by young women in festivals, originated from geisha in male clothing.
Tekomai, which is now performed mostly by young women in festivals, originated from geisha in male clothing.

sen.j: 前髪は膨らませず、中央で分けて左右に振り分ける。
sen.e: The hair on the top front of the head does not bulge, sectioned at the crown of the head, parted left and right.
The bangs are not bulged, but parted in the middle and thrown left and right.
The bangs are not bulged, but parted in the middle and thrown left and right.

sen.j: 髷は非常に太く、刷毛先を非常に太く膨らませる。
sen.e: The topknot is very thick, and the ends of the topknot are splayed very widely.
The topknot is very thick, and the ends of the topknot are splayed very widely.
The topknot is very thick, and the ends of the topknot are splayed very widely.

sen.j: それ以外は女性的な感じも残してある。
sen.e: For the rest, this hairstyle has some femininity left.
For the rest, this hairstyle has some femininity left.
For the rest, this hairstyle has some femininity left.
